controls.title: Windows Server 2022 create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Windows Server 2022 create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> Create symbolic links to include only the following accounts or groups:

- Administrators

Systems that have the Hyper-V role will also have "Virtual Machines" given this user right. If this needs to be added manually, enter it as "NT Virtual Machine\Virtual Machines".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Create symbolic links" user right can create pointers to other objects, which could expose the system to attack.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Windows Server 2022 debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Windows Server 2022 debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> Debug programs to include only the following accounts or groups:

- Administrators

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Debug programs" user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components. This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Windows Server 2022 must be configured for certificate-based authentication for domain controllers.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Windows Server 2022 must be configured for certificate-based authentication for domain controllers.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the registry value.
Registry Hive: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
Registry Path: SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Kdc
 
Value Name: StrongCertificateBindingEnforcement
 
Value Type: REG_DWORD
Value: 0x00000001 (1) or 0x00000002 (2)

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: Active Directory domain services elevation of privilege vulnerability could allow a user rights to the system, such as administrative and other high-level capabilities.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Windows Server 2022 must be configured for name-based strong mappings for certificates.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Windows Server 2022 must be configured for name-based strong mappings for certificates.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Template >> System >> KDC >> Allow name-based strong mappings for certificates to "Enabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: Weak mappings give rise to security vulnerabilities and demand hardening measures. Certificate names must be correctly mapped to the intended user account in Active Directory. A lack of strong name-based mappings allows certain weak certificate mappings, such as Issuer/Subject AltSecID and User Principal Names (UPN) mappings, to be treated as strong mappings.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.
